definitions.definition: A person living on adjacent or nearby land; a person situated adjacently or nearby; anything (of the same type of thing as the subject) in an adjacent or nearby position.
definitions.example: My neighbour has two noisy cats.

definitions.definition: One who is near in sympathy or confidence.

definitions.example: Though France neighbours Germany, its culture is significantly different.

definitions.definition: (followed by "on"; figurative) To be similar to, to be almost the same as.
definitions.example: That sort of talk is neighbouring on treason.

definitions.definition: To associate intimately with; to be close to.
